intro: Peperomia juniniana, commonly known as the Junín peperomia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Peru and Bolivia. This plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and fleshy, waxy leaves that are often variegated in color. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Peperomia juniniana is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its low maintenance requirements and ability to thrive in bright, indirect light.
